data.name: Bass Ackwards Berryblue Ale
data.description: Bass Ackwards Berryblue Ale is brewed during the Maine blueberry harvest. It is an unfiltered, all-natural mild pale ale made with Maine blueberries. It is a refreshing, well balanced beer that has a crisp, fruity aroma and finishes clean and dry. The name Bass Ackwards Berryblue Ale is for its unconventional use of only fresh blueberries in the fermenter without the use of flavorings added, unlike most blueberry ales. The result is a surprisingly simple drinkability that enables you to drink more than one. Try a Black and Blue, our Bass Ackwards mixed with our rich Lake Trout Stout.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with fruit, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Sebago Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Sebago Brewing Company we brew our beers from all malt. We use American grown 2-Row, caramel, chocolate, black, roasted barley and Munich malts from Briess Malting Company. Our grain silo holds 50,000 lbs. of American 2-Row Pale malt. We purchase our grain by the truckload and the bulk grain is blown into the silo from the grain truck. We use 75-80% of this grain in all of our beers. Then we measure our specialty malts into the mill. At this point we crush the malt so that the husk's are cracked open and the "meat" of the grain is exposed.

breweries.name: Beck's Brewery
breweries.description:
Beck's Brewery (Brauerei Beck & Co) is a brewery in the north German city of Bremen. Owned by local families until February 2002, it was then sold to Interbrew  for 1.8 billion euros. The brewery was formed under the name Kaiserbrauerei Beck & May o.H.G. on 27 June 1873, by Lüder Rutenberg (8 February 1816 ? 14 June 1890), Heinrich Beck, and Thomas May. On 1 October 1875, Thomas May left the brewery which then became known as Kaiserbrauerei Beck & Co.

Beck's ranks number 5 among Germany's best selling breweries.

data.description: Our blackberry honey ale, made with 600 lbs. of real, fresh fruit and just the right amount of honey, has a beautiful deep ruby color and blackberry flavor and aroma.

breweries.name: Thunder Canyon Brewery
breweries.description:
Thunder Canyon Brewery, Located in the foothills Mall in Northwest Tucson opened in November of 1997.

Tucson's most award winning brewpub. Locally owned and independent.
 
Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.

breweries.name: Begyle Brewing
breweries.description:
Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.

Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.

data.name: Belgian Blonde with Fruit
data.description:
This Imperial Belgian Blonde ale has a very mellow Belgian yeast character that shows light notes of bubble gum. Balanced sweetness helps to round out the finish and make this a very satisfying, easy to drink beer.
 BLUEBERRY – The addition of blueberry puree in secondary fermentation complements the beer with subtle layers of berry aroma and a slightly tart flavor.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Dust Bowl Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Welcome to Dust Bowl Brewing Company located in Turlock, Ca. We are a small brewing company in the Central Valley of California. Our size allows us to have a very personal and passionate connection to each of our beers. We are continuously testing new flavors and styles to develop our selection of beers. Our goal is to help create a thriving beer culture in the Central Valley.

Our company is a tribute to the strong-willed, gritty people of the Dust Bowl and Great Depression era. Inspired by the families who came west in search of a new start as well as those who stayed behind to weather the storm. This is great beer born of hard times. Storm’s comin’!

data.name: Belgian Cranberry Wheat
data.description: A belgian wheat made with homemade cranberry sauce (fresh cranberries and turbinado sugar).

breweries.name: I & I Brewing
breweries.description:
We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.
 
One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

data.name: Berried In Sand
data.description: A variation on our light smooth crisp Blonde Ale with just a hint of summer berries to give it a decidedly unique and refreshing flavor.  Great for the non-beer drinker in the group or those beer lovers looking for a change of pace.  A really nice as a summer brew for barbecues and picnics, or to wean your friends off watery mass-produced lagers.

breweries.name: Man Cave Brewing Company
breweries.description: Three friends turned a renovated pole building in Syracuse, Indiana, into a guys retreat. A perfect hangout to relieve the daily stress with no work, no worries, and of course no women!

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

breweries.name: Brite Eyes Brewing Company
breweries.description: Brite Eyes Brewing Co. is a microbrewery/coffeehouse located in Kalamazoo, MI. We feature a deli style menu, locally roasted espresso drinks, and our signature hand crafted ales. We brew our beer on a small 1 barrel system, which allows us the flexibility to create a rotating tap list of experimental ales, as well as our main stay beers. Our family friendly tap room features high ceilings, lively colors, and a beautiful view of downtown Kalamazoo.

data.name: Berry Confused
data.description: Raspberries, Blackberries, Blueberries, Strawberries, and 2-types of Cherries combine to give this Fruit/wheat beer a diverse flavor palate.  Just as light, and easy to drink as our Orchard Street Raspberry Wheat, but with lots more berry flavors thrown into the mix.

breweries.name: Three Rivers Eatery And Brewhouse
breweries.description:
The Three Rivers Eatery and Brewhouse was established in 1997 by John Silva, Bob and Cindy Beckley in Farmington, New Mexico. The restaurant and brewery is located in downtown Farmington, on 101 East Main Street. It was formerly called the Andrews Building, and was built and opened in 1912. It was built to house The Farmington Drug Store and The Farmington Times-Hustler Newspaper (now The Daily Times), which became the longest standing drugstore and fountain in New Mexico.

The unique decor consists mostly of priceless items found in the building during the renovation. Three Rivers believes in preserving their historical heritage of downtown Farmington. The restaurant was expanded in July, 1999. The addition includes an outdoor private patio, a bar, and the largest beer label and beer coaster collections in New Mexico. The restaurant has occupancy to provide for large party dining and special private parties. We also sell t-shirts, caps and 1/2 gallon jugs of all our brews.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. breweries.name: Cape Cod Beer
breweries.description:
Cape Cod Beer is about Beer. Its about brewing the best beer possible, on Cape Cod, for people who love Cape Cod. Its about having fun, and following Todd’s calling (and passion) to brew beer professionally. Its about sharing that experience with those we meet along the way that feel the same way about beer as we do.

Cape Cod Beer is Cape Cod's only microbrewery, with beer on draught in and growlers between Plymouth and Provincetown.

If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

Happy Hour M-F: 1-6pm

data.name: Berry Weiss
data.description: A real warm-weather refresher, Leinenkugels Berry Weiss is brewed from a blend of Pale and Wheat malts and Cluster hops, then sweetened with fresh Wisconsin loganberries, elderberries and blackberries. Available April through September
data.foodPairings: The fresh picked flavor of Berry Weiss perfectly complements everything from decadent chocolate cake to fresh caprese salad and creamy spinach and artichoke dip.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with fruit, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Leinenkugel’s. The brand born in Wisconsin’s Northwoods 143 years ago, shares a powerful story of adventure, family and brewing heritage. A story of fifth generation craft brewers. And a portfolio of 11 distinctive, flavorful beers. No other brewer more passionately shares its family history or connects with its fans like Leinie’s. 

The Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company produced its first beer in 1867 for the thirsty lumberjacks inhabiting Wisconsin’s Northwoods. Based in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin, the brand has continued in the rich European tradition of brewing crisp, refreshing, and delicious craft beers.

data.name: Berry White
data.description: A Summer wheat/cream ale brewed with pale malt and white wheat; finished with natural blackberries. This beer finishes dry, with a residual creaminess from the lactose. Mellow, crisp, and fruity for those hot summer days.

breweries.description: Livermore is no longer only wine country! Altamont Beer Works is Livermore's future local brewery; owned and operated by Stephen Sartori and Greg Robles. Keep posted for updates and opening projections. Cheers!

breweries.name: Best Damn Brewing Co.
breweries.description: At the Best Damn Brewing Co. we're on a mission to bring you the best damn thing you've had all day. We'll do whatever it takes to bring you great tasting, easy-to-drink, well-crafted brews that we hope you love as much as we do!

data.name: Biberry
data.description: BiBerry is an abnormal fruit-beer committed to a harmony of blackberries and raspberries fermented dry to provide a burst of fruit aroma, a bright tart flavor and straight ahead thirst satisfaction!

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. breweries.name: Philadelphia Brewing Co
breweries.description: This is, Philadelphia's one and only Philadelphia Brewing Company; brewers of fine hand crafted Ales from our historic brewery building in the Kensington neighborhood of Philadelphia. Like the history of brewing in Philadelphia the name Philadelphia Brewing Company has gone through many revivals. The same can be said of our brewery building - the former Wiesbrod and Hess Brewing Company complex in Kensington. At Philadelphia Brewing Co we take pride in our brews, our people, and our community. One person could never do everything that it takes to get beer into your glass. And it may sound obvious, but we won't brew anything that we wouldn't drink ourselves - you won't catch us drinking anything called Ultra unless it's a literal name meaning more flavor, more hops, more malt, more carbs. That's because we are Brewers; proud brewers of fine hand crafted Ales from our historic brewery building in the Kensington neighborhood of Philadelphia. Now that's out of the way; we will be starting out with four mainstay brews which will be available in draught and in bottles. Once we're stocked up on the core brews we'll start pumping out regular seasonal or specialty brews. The specialty series will be driven by our individual brewers and the desires and whims of the rest of our family.  The beer is flowing at Philadelphia Brewing co! You can find our four brands on tap at finer establishments all around town!

breweries.name: Brasserie Grain D'Orge
breweries.description: Once named Brasserie Jeanne D'Arc, this Brewery had changed their name due to change in management.

data.name: Big Blue Van
data.description: This groovy American style wheat beer is infused with the far out flavors of blueberry and vanilla.  So when the moon is in the seventh house and Jupiter aligns with Mars grab yourself a Big Blue Van and ask yourself... whats so funny about peace, love and understanding?

breweries.name: College Street Brewhouse & Pub
breweries.description: Just a quick drive to the north side of town, you'll find yourself at Havasu's hippest new brewhouse and pub. Here we focus on creating one-of-a-kind handcrafted beers. Revelers will appreciate sipping a smooth, flavorful craft brew while enjoying our rustic cuisine. Our casual atmosphere, outdoor dining, large bar and views of Lake Havasu are sure to become your favorite place to come and unwind.

data.name: BIG MAMA BLUEBERRY ALE
data.description: An amber ale named after the biggest wave on the Kennebec River. Natural blueberry flavor is added at kegging for a great fruity aroma! This is a well-carbonated summer favorite with light malt flavor and a nice crisp finish.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. breweries.name: Kennebec River Pub & Brewery
breweries.description:
The Kennebec River Pub & Brewery is located at Northern Outdoors Adventure Resort in the North Woods logging village of The Forks, Maine. Northern Outdoors is New England's most diverse and accessible adventure destination, offering an authentic outdoor experience and first class amenities in any season. The brewery began pouring pints for thirsty woodcutters, rafters, hikers, snowmobilers and tourists at the resort, in January 1997.

Kennebec River beers are unfiltered and all natural, with no preservatives, additives or stabilizers. We handcraft our beers with the utmost care, using the finest malted barley, premium domestic and imported hops, superior yeasts, and pure water. Good flavorful beer, brewed in small batches right here in the North Woods of Maine! Cheers!

data.name: Birra Minestra
data.description: experimental blonde ale brewed with fresh Oregon basil, Creative Growers Sungold tomatoes, and tart plums. inspired by a dessert from legendary Portland farm-to-table restaurant Park Kitchen

breweries.description: Breakside Brewery is the invention of Scott Lawrence and Tony Petraglia. Some mutual friends introduced the two after learning they both had a desire to leave their corporate jobs in order to pursue their dream of opening a brew pub. They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

data.description: Carefully brewed to the German purity law of the raw hops, malt and water. This high-quality natural product is a top-fermented, fresh and spicy full-bodied beer with lemon soda, carbonic acid, citric acid and flavors.

breweries.name: Bitburger Brauerei
breweries.description: Bitburger is one of the leading breweries in Germany. Since 1817 the beer is brewed to the highest standards and of course according to the German Purity Law. Our products are Bitburger Premium Pils, Bitburger Radler, Bitburger Cola, Bitburger Alcohol-free, alcohol-free and Bitburger Radler Bitburge r Light. We support many sports, however, a special passion is football. We are since 1992, an official partner of the DFB and the German national soccer team. In addition, we promote different football clubs from the regional to the Bundesliga.

data.description: 60% mild beer, 40% pomegranate soft drink.

data.name: Bitburger Radler
data.description: Distinctively tangy and tart with a fine touch. Equal parts of Bitburger Premium Pils Bitburger taste and fresh lemonade shandy with 2.5 percent alcohol by volume is not so sweet. Its typical Bitburger Pils taste gives in to its unique tart note and makes it an ideal thirst-quencher.

breweries.name: BJ's Restaurant and Brewery
breweries.description:
To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

locations.name: Little Rock
locations.hoursOfOperation:
11 am - 12 am Sunday-Thursday
11 am - 1 am Friday-Saturday

data.name: Bjorn to Boogie (Spring-Summer)
data.description:
Watermelon-y, wheaty goodness.

BLAME IT ON THE SUNSHINE. BLAME IT
ON THE MOONLIGHT. BLAME IT ON THE GOOD
TIME. BUT DON’T BLAME IT ON THE
BOOGIE, OH NO NO NO. ‘COS WITHOUT
THE BOOGIE YOUAIN’T GOT THE SASS
IN THIS BOTTLE, YO!

DAS DEUTSCH: (SCHULD AUF
DIE SONNENCREME,
MOND HUND, UND GUTE SEXUELLE APPETIT.
ABER NICHT ESSEN WALE, WEIL ES
SCHLECHT IST, OH NEIN. DA OHNE
BOOGIE IST NICHT DU DIE
FRECHHEIT IN DIESER FLASCHE.)

Uber-refreshing stuff! Classic bavarian wheat characters of banana, clove and bubblegum, plus a big hit of juicy watermelon, lime and mint. Yummo.

ICH LIEBE DICH MEIN FREUND!

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. breweries.name: Moon Dog
breweries.description:
The Moon Dog brewery is as hand-crafted as the delicious beer it produces. A good chunk of the brewing gear was cobbled together from second-hand farming and dairy equipment.

The brewhouse is a four vessel 13hL electric system (hot liquor, mash/lauter kettle and whirlpool). The beautiful and shiny fermentation system is comprised of an ever-growing farm of cylindro-conical tanks.

There is a wall of barrels, a painting of "The Big Man" - John Candy, many many chandeliers, a pink elephant (actually, maybe a few..), and most of all a whole lota love.

It has been described by one observer as the “oddest brewery” he's ever seen. We like to call it home.

data.name: Black Cherry
data.description: Start with ice cold, pure artesian spring water from the historic Indian Wells Spring. Then, we add fresh, wild natural black cherries, pure cane sugar and our secret spices for our great black cherry taste.

breweries.name: Big Boss Brewing Company
breweries.description: Big Boss Brewing Company was started in 2006 and shipped its first beer in the 2nd quarter of 2007 in the triangle area of North Carolina. It was formed as collaboration between Geoff Lamb, a UNC graduate, who returned to North Carolina in 2006 to join forces with Brewmaster, Brad Wynn, who has 12+ years of brewing experience including several years with Victory, Wild Goose and Native Brewing Company.

data.name: Black Ice Blackberry Ale
data.description:
Black Ice is a very mild flavored Blackberry Pale Ale. We use fresh fruit in the late stages of fermentation to provide a subtle blackberry nose and a late flavor addition that builds as you get further into the pint. 
 People seem to enjoy Black Ice, we hope you will too. We only kegged about 8 and a half barrels so get it while you can!

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. breweries.name: Muddy Creek Brewery
breweries.description:
We craft a variety of exquisite and delicious beers. There is sure to be several brews that please most every palate.  For the kids of all ages, we also craft excellent soft drinks such as Teetotaler Sparkling Lemonade and Where's Your Mother Root-Beer.  For those seeking beverages other than beer, feel free to visit The Post Martini Bar just a few feet down the hall from us.

We provide free popcorn and you are welcome to bring in your own food or order-in food in from a variety of restaurants in the area.

We are located in the historic Post building in Uptown Butte on corner of Main and Galena.  This tastefully-remodeled historic space has been designed to facilitate a fantastic customer experience focusing on a rustic relaxed atmosphere, easy conversation, quality music, friendly & knowledgeable staff, great beer and good times!

breweries.name: Naked Dove Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Naked Dove Brewing company was born through our passionate commitment to the art and science of brewing.

At Naked Dove we concentrate on doing one thing: utilizing the best ingredients that the world has to offer to brew world class beers locally. The beers have passed our strict quality standards to ensure that they will meet yours. We are located in Canandaigua, NY in the beautiful Finger Lakes region of New York.

data.name: Black Raspberry Reserve
data.description: An unforgettable wheat ale brewed with German Pils and Wheat malts and Tradition hops, with 1 lb. of red and black raspberries per gallon of beer. This beer features a tart finish and a sugary sorbet aroma.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Fruit Beer
style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with fruit, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Sly Fox Brewing Company
breweries.description: A full production brewery and accompanying restaurant opened in 2004 by the owners of Sly Fox Brewhouse & Eatery in nearby Phoenixville. The 20bbl brewhouse packages a wide range of beers in 12oz cans, 22oz bottles and 750ml bottles. Pikeland Pils, a multiple GABF Gold Medal Winner, and O'Reilly's Stout, a nitro-poured, draught-only beer named after brewer Brian O'Reilly's grandfather are among its most popular beers, on and off premises, as are such Belgian-style delights as Incubus Tripel, Ichor Quadrupel, Saison Vos & Black Raspberry Reserve. Sly Fox is also noted for its Bock Beers (see listing for the Phoenixville pub for more details) and annual Christmas Ale.

data.name: Blackberry Ale
data.description: A year round treat, has a dark ruby looking complexion with layers of rich malt, subtle hints of blackberry and smooth finish brewed with 2 Row Barley, Chocolate and Crystal Malts. This unique ale has won several awards at multiple Brew Festivals, a great beer to share with your friends.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Fruit Beer

breweries.name: Big E Ales
breweries.description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.

data.name: Blackberry Ale
data.description: Over thirty pounds of all natural blackberry puree were added this coral colored ale in order to provide bright authentic fruit flavors. Mildly sweet, yet refreshingly tart- an ideal beer for the final days of summer. Malt: Canadian 2-Row Hops: Warrior

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Fruit Beer

breweries.name: Nashoba Valley Winery
breweries.description:
Our brewery was established in 2004 to provide a wide range of flavorful Ales and Lagers, brewed and packaged on site at our picturesque farm. Each beer is hand crafted in small batches, employing both traditional brewing methods and American craft-brewing creativity. We offer our fine micro-brewed beers on draft with your meal at J’s Restaurant and for sale at our Wine Shoppe.

We mill our grain on site and grow hops used in our operations. All beers are 100% brewed and packaged on site. There are no additives or preservatives in our beers.

data.name: Blackberry Blonde
data.description: “Hubba Hubba!”A light wheat ale. A highly drinkable brew with a pungent burst of natural blackberry.

data.name: Blackberry Saison
data.description: Urbn Saison with fresh blackberries. Pours a pale off-pink. Intense berry flavor balanced by the base beers yeast and hop aromas.

breweries.name: URBN Brewing Co.
breweries.description: URBN Brewing Co., founded by Alex Carballo, Jon Mangini, and head brewer Callaway Ryan, is a craft brewery located in El Cajon, CA.

breweries.name: O'Fallon Brewery
breweries.description: At the O'Fallon Brewery we are passionate about making beer and we work hard to brew beers that appeal to customers and taste great! We recently moved into a new facility in Maryland Heights, MO just a few miles east from our original location. Our new location has a restaurant and bar where consumers can try a wide variety of different beers made by our brewing team.
